meanings.definition: The quality or state of having a notion or idea.
meanings.sent1: Her notionality about the topic was clear from the way she explained it.
meanings.sent2: His notionality of the subject was evident in his detailed presentation.
meanings.sent3: The notionality of the plan made everyone laugh because it was so simple.
meanings.sent4: The notionality of her creativity shone through her artwork.
meanings.sent5: The notionality of his argument was so strong that it convinced everyone.

meanings.definition: The concept or understanding of something.
meanings.sent1: The notionality of the theory was difficult to grasp at first.
meanings.sent2: She had a clear notionality of the project's goals.
meanings.sent3: The notionality of the joke made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His notionality of success was like a beacon guiding him.
meanings.sent5: The notionality of the story stayed with me long after I heard it.

meanings.definition: The mental capacity to form ideas or concepts.
meanings.sent1: His notionality allowed him to come up with innovative solutions.
meanings.sent2: The notionality of a child is truly fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent3: The notionality of the puzzle kept him entertained for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her notionality was like a wellspring of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The notionality of his mind was a source of inspiration for many.
